inn1.comm: just about back of a length first up, not as much bounce as Amla expected, flicked away to midwicket who make s a good stop
shorter this time, but directed on the pads, pulled away dismissively to the man at fine leg, very short boundary in that area
goes much fuller and across around off stump to Smith, who takes a half-step forward and pushes wide of extra cover
138.6 kph and pegs Amla on the back foot with a short of a good length ball, he pushes it out to point,
143.4 kph searing yorker, Amla gets bat down on it in just in time, and squeezes it wide of point to third man
138.1 kph short of a length ball that offers width to Smith, and he goes for the cut, but it also bounces extra, and beats hiim, keeper clangs the take, good start from Rankin
125 kph comes back in from short of a length, blocked down the track
the inward movement and the angle takes this one down the leg side
gets it to move in from just short of a length outside off stump, it bounces too much for Amla's comfort and he fends it away on the leg side, taking one hand off the bat
another one comes back in, this time off a fuller length, brings bat and pad close together and defends
gets one in his zone, length ball angled on the pads, sends it scurrying along the ground past midwicket
length ball outside off, driven with lovely timing wide of mid off where Cusack dives to his left and saves the boundary
off a thick outside edge towards second slip along the ground as Smith pushes at one that kept a shade low
139.9 kph, he is working up some lively pace, whipped off the pads wide of mid on
bit of bounce outside off stump, steered away to third man
Amla launches into a violent pull, gets it off the bottom half of the bat, but Wilson at midwicket goes leaping to his left, and stops it on the bounce
more bounce from Boyd, Smith shoulders arms outside off
a bit fuller outside off stump, and he gets beside the line and chops it wide of second slip to third man
speared wide down the leg side, searching for the full delivery on the stumps
looks to drive this length ball outside off stump past Boyd, but gets it off the inner half of the blade, bowler fields
plays out a length ball on the stumps on the leg side
stays in the crease and chops one going across him towards point
looks to come out and go through his favourite midwicket, Johnston shortens the length and he blocks it away
gets one a bit fuller, opes up and works it away wide of midwicket
this man is in some form, he just stands in the crease and swats a length ball, it races wide of mid off who fires in the throw, but Amla is quick enough
shuffles across in hope but cannot work this one away, it is on a length outside off and he pats it away
140.2 kph and full outside off stump, Amla does not need any more invitation, gets forward and sends it in the gap at covers for a boundary
steepling bounce from Rankin, there was a lot of width outside off stump, but even as Amla stood on his toes to cut it over point, he was beaten by the bounce

another short of a length delivery, this time Amla latches on to it instantly, jeez, that was not short enough, but he just lifted it over deep midwicket for maximum, now that's timing, and making the most of your form

and now he is gone, Amla goes for the upper cut, something he had attempted two deliveries earlier, but too much of a thick outside edge this one as he connects from outside off stump, the ball swirls quickly wide of third man where young Dockrell dives to his left and pulls off the stunner, it did not lodge cleanly in his hands but he kept them close to his chest, and managed to hold on as he fell
142.6 kph angling across Smith on a length who leaves it alone, Rankin has settled in to a fine rhythm
and again he is that channel close to off, Smith shoulders arms
gets bat close to pad outside off and blocks a length ball
127.9 kph jags back in sharply from short of a length outside off, he is in some discomfort as he keeps it down
in the air, but he gets in the gap, did not quite middle this punch-drive, it seemed to stop on him but he went through with it and got it past mid off
the ball seems to be hovering and wobbling in the air, arrives late outside van Wyk who pushes it away uncertainly to point
gets it to move in off the seam around off stump and he defends off the back foot

dropped it is Kevin O'Brien at short cover who puts down the tough chance, it was a length ball that was smashed by van Wyk, went straight to Kevin who got both hands to it but could not hold on, Johnston is distraught
worked away off the hip to deep square leg
gets half-forward to a length ball outside off stump, and pushes in the gap in front of covers
gets a shade across and blocks this one going across him towards cover
shuffles and sends this back of a length ball behind square leg off
gets forward to a length ball and drives to cover, he is consistently looking to come out and drive through extra cover
reaches out again, this one is held back a bit and his drive goes in the air down to third man
punched away to cover off the back foot, lets the ball angle in to him from outside off

goes for the lofted shot over midwicket, but gets too much underneath the ball and sends it almost perpendicular in the air, there are some monstrous dark clouds hanging above the ground, but only the ball comes down this time, couple of bounces and rolls away in to the wide long on boundary
pushed out in to the off side from the crease
wants to drive down the ground, gets too much across and hits it off the inner half to the bowler
van Wyk is going for everything, backs away a shade and lifts this back of a length ball over extra cover, just thumping through the line of the ball, effective at the moment
pushes it towards mid on and goes through for the run, makes it even as the throw hits the non-striker's stumps
cuts back in from wide outside off stump, and strikes him high on the pad as he pushes forward
bowls a full toss outside off stump, and in the mood van Wyk is in, and how quick the outfield is, he stretches out and times it in the gap between cover and point
van Wyk is doing some real damage here upfront, and taking the pressure off Smith, stands tall and lofts the length ball high over mid off for another boundary

another dropped chance, Ireland are hurting themselves big time, they are so safe normally in the field, Rankin got one to cut back in from wide outside off stump, van Wyk went for the drive as usual, and the outside edge flew to Stirling at slip who clanged it, it climbed on him fast, but he could not quite get his hands to it, Rankin is stunned, totally stunned
pushed in front of mid off for a quick single
meanwhile, Smith continues to struggle to middle them, awkwardly pushes this one down the track
lets this length ball come back in from outside off and calmly defends from the crease
pushes the ball late wide of cover and they go through for the run even as the fielder fails to cleanly pick up the ball
Smith endeavors forward purposefully, but the drive does not find the middle of the bat, and he gets a single wide of mid off

Ireland make up for those clangers a bit, it is Mooney from midwicket, van Wyk had shuffled across to work the single away, but Mooney was close by, Smith got too far down the track in his haste for the run, he turned back and put in the dive, but Mooney had already found the stumps by then, the crowd roar, Ireland celebrate
waits for this one to jag back in from short of a length, and pushes it away to cover off the back foot, they are done with attempting those suicidal singles for the moment
gets it right on target on off stump, he comes out and blocks resolutely
goes for the full delivery, ends up as a low full toss on the pads, Kallis cannot put it away, plays it out wide of midwicket
hops on the toes and goes for the cut, but still the bounce on this one beats him outside off stump
squirts this length ball past the non-striker and pinches a single by the time mid on gets to it, absolutely safe this time
hops in the air to bring down this one that gets big on him in front of square leg, that;s the way to deal with those nasty ones

and then, that;s the way to put those full ones away, it's on middle stump, and Kallis connects beautifully with the straightest of bats, big followthrough as the ball races past the hapless bowler to the straight boundary
opens him up a bit with a short of a length ball, and he pushes it away to point
cramps him for room in the crease with a length ball that comes in, he defends
stands back in the crease to cut this one away, but manages to get it as far as point
he holds the bat almost perpendicular in the air, what a monstrous backlift, this one is short, and he swivels instantly and the pull dispatches the ball through square leg
surprises him with a lovely slower one around off stump, he plays it out towards point
crack! he is really loving Eden. marginally short, and almost as if he had been waiting for it, he picks it high over deep midwicket, just stands in the crease and goes for the full swing of the bat
another one, he is throwing his bat at everything, this one is floated wide of off stump, and he gets the edge through the vacant slip cordon
trots in and bowls one on the stumps, it is worked away to midwicket
124.9 kph but it is dug in and makes him stand on his toes to keep it down on the off side

short of a length again, this one does not get up as much, and Kallis is ready when it arrives, delays the shot a bit to get the placement right, and punches it past cover, no chance as soon as it passes the infield
times the punch off the back foot again, this time to cover on the edge of the circle
gets Kallis to come forward and he gets the drive right out of the middle, it drops just short of a diving point, Mooney has his hands on his heads
goes on his toes to bring down another lifting short of a length ball, on the leg side this time
goes straight on from a length, played out on the leg side
comes down the track, he shortens the length, pushed away on the off side
fuller on the stumps, flicked away to midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
there is sweeper cover, but he can only watch the ball slam in to the ropes, marginally short, he goes back and cracks the cut past cover and too quick for the man on the boundary
not much room this time, defended on the off side
Porterfield at point saves a certain boundary, it was cut hard off the back foot, but he dived and stopped it on the bounce
slower one wide outside off stump, left alone
gets across to whip a back of a length ball to deep midwicket
goes back in the crease and guides this wide one to third man
fuller outside off stump, he goes for a languid drive, too languid, as it rolls away to short extra cover
stuck in the crease to one that cramps him for room, pushed back down the track
pushed back down the tracj
thumped off the front foot, cannot beat extra cover
slower through the air, he goes back and pushes it on the off side
lovely delivery, tossed up on off stump, draws him in to the drive, and gets it go straight on, off the inside edge towards square leg, Dockrell smile

it couldn't get through the great man, but it has consumed van Wyk, flighted and went straight on, he had backed away for the cut, not short enough for the shot, not wide enough at all, and to his horror it kept a bit low too, and beat the attempted cut to crash in to off stump, lovely bowling, the adventure of van Wyk at Eden is over
gets a flighted one on the leg stump, and flicks it past short midwicket, but mid on runs to his left to cut it off
from round the stumps, slides this one past off stump, invitation for the cut, Duminy leaves
touch shorter outside off, pushed away to point
wider outside off, this time he cuts, and picks up a single
beats him in flight, gets it to turn in sharply, he was forward and went for the drive outside the line, struck outside the line of off on the pads
goes to slip who takes it, but off the pads as he again plays outside the line of one that turns in a long way
this time Kallis is wiser, plays it with the turn towards midwicket, and picks up the single too
Dockrell continues to toss them up, he drives off the inner half of the bat to the bowler
another one generous on the flight, but  outside off stump, and Kallis creams it off the front foot, sweeper cover makes good ground to cut it off
goes across and outside off stump to defend one that turns in
worked on the leg side off the back foot
turned towards square leg of the back foot
goes for the full-blooded drive again to a tossed up ball, but hits it in to the ground
a shade short and turning away, he rocks back and punches it wide of sweeper cover to pick up a couple
gets well forward to smother this one that turns away
goes back to punch another shortish one, it doesn't turn, and he gets it to the right of the bowler, who goes leaping to his right to stop it
another one goes straight on from back of a length, he is backing away to  cut repeatedly, squeezed back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, almost yorker length, driven down the track
whipped away wide of long on from a fuller length
gets the leading edge as he plays for the turn and it goes straight on, but along the ground to cover
driven hard in the ground on the bounce to extra cover
this time driven along the ground, to extra cover again
backs away, but this one hurries on and he chops it towards point
waits for this shortish one to come on, and punches it to sweeper cover
another tossed up ball goes straight on, this time Duminy does not commit too far forward and pushes it away
flicked with the turn from outside off to midwicket
whipped away with the turn again to deep midwicket, he has not played outside the line since those couple of close calls early on

Kallis is in trouble, he was not quick enough to beat the throw as Duminy worked one away to midwicket, was a bit slow off the blocks as the throw came in from Porterfield, Niall had the bails off quickly, it is a close call as the replays show, but Kallis has to walk back, he cannot believe it, he did not put in the dive either, has himself to blame
shuffles across the stumps to work a turning delivery backward of square leg
turning away from a length, cut away wide of extra cover, there is sweeper cover on the boundary
stands outside off stump to counter the turn in to him, and whips it away to midwicket
sweeps from way outside off stump, and gets it down to deep square leg
gets half forward in defence uncertainly, bat and pad close together, ball hits bit of both, Ireland are excited
driven for a single down the ground on the off side
leaves the crease, gets to the pitch, and whips it away with the turn to the left of midwicket
du Plessis comes down the track this time, and drives to extra cover
tossed up nicely, and goes straight on outside off stump, he had no clue about it, and shuffled wide outside off stump to block it away awkwardly
fired in from round the stumps, hits him on the pads down the leg side
goes on with the arm again, this time around leg stump, pushed off the back foot down the ground
sharp turn in to the batsman, who is standing outside off stump, and gets an inside edge backward of square leg
keeps a shade low as it is pushed through flat on leg stump, played out in front of midwicket
much fuller now, driven to the bowler off the front foot
just a tad short and outside off stump, he quickly goes back and cuts it to sweeper cover
shuffles across , they have done this a lot today, and works it away towards midwicket
tossed up and goes straight on, he is quick to get on the back foot an punch it wide of sweeper cover
bit of width outside off stump, slapped away to sweeper cover off the back foot
stays in the back foot to a flighted delivery, dangerous ploy, is hurried in to the defensive push
now he leaves the crease and earns a single with a push along the ground to long on
guided to point off the back foot
hurries on from a length on off stump, he backs away and cuts it for a single past extra cover
waits in the crease for this to turn in and dabs it away late past a diving slip, deftly done
looks to do it again, this one is pushed through quicker, doesn't bounce much and doesn't turn much, he is beaten as he pushes inside the line
driven hard wide of short extra cover, who dives and creates a run out chance, but these two are quick between the wickets
eased down to long off for a strolled single
walks way outside off stump, and pats away a turning delivery on the off side
from round the stumps, bowls one close to off stump, he looks to steer it away and is beaten
shuffles across and gets it away off the pads towards square leg, Niall goes charging after it from behind the stumps
whips away this one from back of a length to midwicket
dug in from short of a length, bounces too much for his comfort and he keeps it down on the off side
fuller and much slower on the stumps, he picks it and pushes it down to long on for a single
almost got him there, but an inside edge seemed to save him as he missed the drive to a length ball angled in to him, and the ball went on to hit the pad and rolled away
walks outside off again, as he has done during this knock, and pushes it away towards point
flicked away backward of square leg for a quick run

guided straight to slip, that's the way it is done during training, it was flighted outside off stump, drifted away from the batsman a touch, he came forward, opened the face of the bat and steered it at a nice catchable height to slip, South Africa are in trouble now, Johnston is delighted
pushed through quicker from round the stumps, defended off the front foot
he is away with a sweep to fine leg off a fuller one
is this another one, Duminy missed the flick to a wide one down the leg side, Niall had the bails off in a flash, was his foot in the air? replays show he just managed to drag his foot back in
shorter on the stumps, he goes back to punch it back to the bowler
whipped away to midwicket off the back foot, rode the bounce on this back of a length ball
he comes forward and gets the drive in the gap between extra cover and mid off, first boundary in ages
defended solidly off the front foot
strays down the pads from a full length, whipped away fine, Niall gets a hand to it and takes the pace off it
gets on the toes to work this one that bounces extra in front of square leg
much fuller on the stumps, clipped away to midwicket, would have liked to put it away
tossed up full delivery, he gets to it and flicks it to deep midwicket
strikes him on the pad as he pushes out outside the line, this one went straight on
this time he gets behind the ball to defend it off the front foot
chops it from close to off stump
flicks it wide of midwicket from a fuller length, in the air for a while
eased down the ground to long on this time
gets back to one a touch short and works it down the ground on the leg side
excellent effort on the fine leg boundary, it was paddled very fine from leg stump, Mooney went diving a long way to his left, super effort
played back down the tracj
pushed to extra cover off the back foot
cannot get it past Stirling in the cover as he looks to punch it away
played away towards midwicket, Ireland are racing through the overs
gets a low full toss on leg stump, but pats it away to midwicket
has him reaching out to a flighted one on middle stump, squeezed away down the track
cut away from off stump to Mooney at cover
gets the single now, shuffles across to work it away in front of square leg
full deliver, he lunges forward and sweeps it to deep square leg
plonks this one in front of covers for a comfortable run
comes down the track, he bowls it flat and he plays it out to midwicket
pushed through a bit fuller, he goes back in the crease and works it away to short fine leg
Ingram goes hard at a flat delivery, lunges forward and slogsweeps it to deep midwicket, well done
gets a leading edge down the track as he looks to turn this full one on the leg side
worked away off the pads to square leg
flicks to short fine leg and sets off for the single, the throw came in very high to Niall, else it could have been close
Duminy goes for the reverse sweep, takes it very low on the full, and gets it past short third man comfortably
stays in the crease to a tossed up fuller one, and chops it in to the ground on the leg side
more flight from Stirling, driven back to the bowler
this time he shuffles quickly across the stumps and whips it away in the gap past square leg
Ingram gets going this time, it was there outside off for the cut, and he got it past short third man and in to the gap
pushed back in the air down the track, almost carried to the bowler
beats him outside off with one that keeps low as he went for the cut
floated up wide outside off stump, moves further away after pitching on a length
driven off the front foot to sweeper cover
bowled slower through the air, he was already on the front foot, it cut away too, and he was beaten on the drive
chopped down to third man in the end, that was homing in off stump, too close for the cut
another slower one, very full this time, he gets forward and squeezes it down to third man
pings extra cover with the front foot drive, too bad he could not get it past the man, it was struck very firmly
hits that splice-jarring length straight away, tapped down to gully and they take a quick single
lift outside off! That's really taken off. Ingram set himself to force through the off side but the ball burst past his outside edge
a little too leg-side from Rankin, and Ingram pulls off his hip, hopping onto one leg as he does so
short again, not a particularly savage bouncer though and Duminy hooks easily out to long leg

the switch-up, Rankin goes full and straight and strikes Duminy on the pad. There's a speculative appeal, but it seemed to have pitched well outside leg. They think about a review ... and eventually ask for one, but it's a waste, pitching half a foot outside leg!
bottom edged! Duminy was trying to run a back-of-a-length delivery down to third man, played for the extra bounce and a bottom edge bounces past his stumps. Good stop by Niall O'Brien
horrid delivery, a real freebie, and Ingram cracks the short, wide long-hop to the point boundary. Cusack knows he's messed up there, a cry of anguish
a touch of width again, not nearly as much though. Tapped to cover point for one
much better line and length there, fuller and straighter. Defended
full, landing on middle and leg. Clipped down to fine leg
definite wobble through the air for Cusack, swinging away from the left-hander from round the wicket. Full too. Tapped back to the bowler
he's spoiled it with the last ball! Short and wide again, slashed to the boundary. Poor bowling, no consistency of line or length. Is he trying to do too much?
fullish length on off stump, the extra bounce means Duminy's defence is slightly awkward
length again, run down to third man for one
slashed down to third man, much too fine for the fielder down there! Rankin isn't happy, but the shot was on to that ball - short and wide
and now he's on the pull! A gentle ball on leg stump, and it's met with savage force by Ingram, who cracks it away well in front of square
tapped out to the cover sweeper for one
very full on off stump, Duminy drives towards mid-off and they just set off ... the fielder is quite deep, but a direct hit would still have been interesting there
full on middle and leg, clipped out to deep midwicket where some athletic fielding saves runs
back-of-a-length on middle, dropped close in on the leg side
angled down to third man
drop-and-run into the covers, there seems to be a really good understanding between these two batsmen, and they're both lightning between the wickets
there's another good example, Duminy just drops the ball at his feet and Ingram calls him through straight away. Professional stuff
forced out to the deep cover boundary, there's another run
clipped gently into the leg side, another quick single
Ingram stays deep, slapping the ball down to long-off
this one keeps slightly low, but Duminy lays bat on ball and they're off in a flash
whipped down to long-on off the back foot this time
tossed up much slower and fuller, angled to gully and another single
good fielding means the last ball is a dot, Ingram nudges to midwicket but the man there slides to cut it off
Johnston comes round the wicket, floating one up outside off and Duminy leans into a languid drive ... a diving cover sweeper can do nothing about it, and there's his fifty
tapped in that direction again, not quite with the same style or timing, but it's two runs all the same
turned off the hip to square leg, quick running

bowled 'im! Trent provides just the inspirational moment Ireland needed, pushing one fuller and straighter. The ball kept a little low, but Ingram was right back when he should have been forward and swiped across the line with no great certainty. No chicken dance from Johnston yet ... actually he looks quite angry!
good length again, slightly fuller and Botha defends from the crease. Johnston won't mind, he should really be further forward playing that shot
Botha walks into a defensive stroke to finish the over, presenting the full face of the bat
nudged to the midwicket fielder
floated up on the breeze, pushed back to the bowler
perhaps a touch too full, eased down to long-on
Botha stays back and is off the mark with a punchy single to long-on
landing on middle and leg, Duminy plays across the front pad to midwicket
fantastic end to Dockrell's spell, floated up on off stump and Duminy defends
Mooney attacks the stumps, finding a touch of inward movement off the seam. Botha defends to leg
angled down to third man
Duminy does the same, chopping on down to third man
saved by the boot! Botha set himself for a cut, but bottom-edged the shot almost straight down ... the ball could've bounced back onto the stumps, but hit his boot and bounced towards gully
glanced down to fine leg
Botha stands tall and tries to force down the ground, but mid-on and midwicket converge to negate any thought of a single
nudged just wide of the man at short fine leg, and so there's time for a single
reverse-sweep! It's a shot he plays very often at the end of the innings, and he's nailed this one. Short third man dives, but the ball is past him in a flash
and again! They didn't change the field so the shot was on, but this time the ball was far too full and nipped under the bat ... but it's well wide of off stump
pushed down to long-on off the back foot
Duminy makes room, but cracks straight to the lone cover fielder in the ring
flicked off the toes behind square on the leg side
Mooney is tight on off stump, but Duminy angles the bat at the last moment to get the ball down to third man
too short for a man of Mooney's pace, Botha rocks back and pulls out to deep midwicket
back of a length once again, this time Botha pings the fielder on the off-side boundary ... straight to him though so just one
angling in towards leg stump from round the wicket, Duminy simply lays bat on ball to get it down to fine leg
slower ball bouncer from Mooney, and it's very slow and very short! Wide of off stump too. Botha tries to smash it a little too hard and picks up just the one out to the cover sweeper
top-edged! But it flies up and over the keeper and away to the boundary! Some luck for Duminy, and Mooney is not amused
nice and full, defended by Botha
back of a length and slightly too straight, Botha stands up and drops the ball close on the leg side, Duminy is through for a single in a blink
short on off stump, Duminy throws everything into the cut but Johnston at third man defies age and infirmity to sprint round and cut it off with neat little tumble and roll
Test match line and length from Rankin on off stump, Botha's feet go nowhere and he's beaten on the outside edge
tapped to gully, another quick single
Duminy chops down on the ball at the last moment to get it down to third man
tapped into space at midwicket, easy single
great keeping! Johnston aims for the yorker, it slips towards leg, hits the pad and would've been four ... but Niall lept to his left and stopped it one-handed
right in the blockhole! Botha digs it out back towards the bowler, but Johnston can't quite creak down in time ... so it's a single
over-throws! It was full, tapped to mid-off and they set off ... there was a shy at the stumps, but the back-up couldn't get round in time
swiped from off stump into the leg side, down to long on
full on off stump again, cracked hard to the mid-off fielder, who is right on the edge of the circle so there's time for a quick single
Beaten! on a length, angling across Duminy and beating the outside edge of an airy drive
Rankin aims for the yorker on off stump, the ball comes off the boot and they take a quick single ... huge appeal from Niall O'Brien, but it's a solo effort
Rankin aims for the yorker again, Botha tucks off his toes down to fine leg who is, you'll remember, on the boundary for him
huge swipe to leg! Duminy was targeting the boundary there, massive swing at the ball and he can't get a touch on it. Shaves just past the off stump
very full on off stump, cracked out to deep cover
beaten by extra bounce outside off! Botha was aiming for a slashing cut, but the ball just leapt over the outside edge. What an over to bowl at this stage
Mooney comes round the wicket, aiming at leg stump. Duminy is beaten on the pull, the ball striking him on the hip
a medium-paced bouncer from Mooney, Duminy steps back and smashes it to the square leg boundary!
short again, it rushes on to Duminy and he toe-ends down to long-on.
fuller on off stump, driven to cover. Man on the edge of the circle cuts it off, just a single
much better length, fuller outside off and Duminy is beaten as he tries to late cut
slower ball, a leg cutter perhaps, and it's gloved into the leg side for one
poor delivery, and Duminy seizes on the opportunity for a boundary. It was a full toss on leg stump and Duminy just smashed it over square leg
full on middle and leg, Duminy is struck on the pad and Botha calls him through. Trent tries to run through his follow through and kick the ball onto the stumps, but the shot goes wide
full, heaved to leg but square leg on the edge of the circle dives to keep them to one
up, up, up into the night sky! That trademark Duminy pick-up over square leg, he got right underneath it and hit it miles
four more, he's onto 97 now! Another full ball, slower, he backed away and tries to lift it over cover and a thick outside edge flew down to third man
great yorker, right at the toes, but they still sneak a leg bye
back of a length on off stump, Duminy plays it down to gully for one
Botha was trying to slap this one into orbit! Huge swing across the line, didn't get anywhere near it. O'Brien stops it with his body, he's up to the stumps
mis-hit slower ball to gully, it gets Duminy back on strike on 99!

Duminy is out for 99! He tried to go down the ground, but sliced at it and got underneath the ball, lifting it very high ... two fielders converge and one of them dives and slides to pull off a great one-handed catch. Guess who? Yep, it's Kevin O'Brien!
slower-ball bouncer, Botha pulls in the air out to long leg but it wasn't the greatest connection
swing-and-a-miss, but O'Brien shys at the stumps, standing back, and they run on the ricochet

inn2.comm: 127.6 kph loosener, just back of a length already that shape in to the left-hander, off the pads on to the leg side
cranks it up immediately to 137.1 kph, back of a length on to the pads again, worked away to square leg
some swing again for Steyn, bowls it much fuller and around that off stump, he gets to the pitch and drives to mid off

Morne gets the fiery stare from Steyn, got too far to his right at fine leg as Porterfield pulled the short one down to him at fine leg, and over ran the ball in the end to allow it to roll in to the boundary
worked away off the pads towards deep square leg, its Morne again, puts in a big dive, and scrambles to stop the ball, keeps them down to a couple finally
good delivery to end the over, back of a length and on the middle stump, defended back to the bowler
bounces high from back of a length, but the line is light years wide of off stump, moves further away, almost ends up at first slip
this one is much better, outside off stump, and left alone
goes for the drive on the up from the crease, nowhere near to the pitch of this length delivery, it came back in too
looks to go big again, but sees this one is homing in on off stump, and blocks it away in the end
plonks this one that bounces close to the stumps, and Porterfield wills him on to the single as the ball rolls away to second slip
angles it in from a length, and he rushes in to the defensive push, gets an inside edge on the leg side

that will do, Morne gets the breakthrough early on, lures Porterfield in to the drive, but driving morne is fraught with danger at the best of times because of that short of a good length he bowls, this one moved away after angling in around off stump, and the outside edge went safely to first slip, the South African slip cordon is as safe as a bank
already pegged on the back foot, this one hurries on from a length, another inside edge on to the leg side
looking for the one that comes in from a length into the left-hander, he nows that is what Steyn is up to, and flicks it behind square

Morne is giving Steyn a torrid time, he has now dropped a straightforward chance, Stirling went for the full-blooded slash, and it flew down to Morne at third man, he went to take it on his knees with hands pointing upwards, and messed it up
on the money, around middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
wants to carve this one through extra cover, it moves away from short of a length, and he ends up swinging wildly from the crease
beats him with a beauty, this is looking very tough for Ireland, survival that is, this one angles in slowly and then moves away close to off stump, he ends up pushing inside the line
chooses to be  on the back foot, and jams down his bat at one that angles in from round the stumps, scoots away in front of square
Stirling is going for them at the slightest opportunity, goes for the cut this time to a wide delivery, and gets it just over a leaping point

Stirling does what du Plessis did earlier, guides one straight to slip, second slip this time, this one came in from short of a length, he was caught in the crease and had a weak dab at it, and it looped slowly in the air to settle in to Jacques Kallis' hands
jags in to the batsman from short of a length, worked away off hip in front of square
shoulders arms to one that is angled in outside off stump, troublesome angle that for left-handers from round the stumps
Joyce gets some width finally, and hungrily capitalises, cuts it away between cover and point for a boundary
thick outside edge wide of third man as he pushes forward
134.9 kph length ball on the leg stump, he closes the face early and gets a leading edge towards extra cover
goes across the left-hander this time, he wants to have a go at it, and does, misses completely, ended up way outside off stump
140.7 kph lifter outside off now that has him moving his bat away at the last instant, well avoided in the end
this one shapes back in from a fuller length around leg stump, and is played out to midwicket
drags it a touch shorter now, making him go on his toes to keep it down on the leg side
lunges forward to one wide outside off stump, and squirts it away to backward point
goes back to his stock back of a length ball, he pushes it away on the off side
chee, that goes all the way, it was swung so cleanly, Morne went fuller and he lifted it over mid on, and just cleared the ropes
flicked in the air off the pads down to fine leg
goes past the outside edge now, Morne reverts to short of a length, and promptly beats him with one that takes off outside off
goes on the toes to block one that bounces around off stump, and rolls away on the off side
looks to go for the pull, but is no position to play the shot, just has a swing from the crease, and it goes offf the thigh pad low to the keeper
Steyn has been a bit too much leg stumpish to the left-handers, this one is worked away to square leg
punches a short of a good length ball to extra cover and shouts 'No', the crowd has built up and is making a lot of noise
138.9 kph on the stumps from a length, squirts away off the defensive push to  point
sees width outside off and goes hard at it, one hand comes off the bat, ball dies down on the keeper, Steyn smiles
gets too far across to one that was angled past him, and cannot time the drive, hits it into the ground

Morne strikes the pads, he thinks he is on to something and goes up in a fervent and drawn out appeal, makes no impression on umpire Dharmasena, hit him high above the knee roll, replays show it clipping top of the stumps
144.8 kph lifter that straightens from around off, as if all that bounce was not enough, left alone immediately
146 kph, this is furious pace, thuds into the bat from a length
bangs the short one in, but the angle takes it wide down the leg side
lets go of another one that straightens outside the off stump from a length, Morne is really making up for those dropped catches

at 139.4 kph, that uncertain line that is half a foot outside off stump, forces him to push at it even as it takes off, grazes him on the arm as he plays outside the line, bounces very close to the stumps in the end
pushed away towards covers off the back foot
right away on that slightly short of a length stuff, played away off the back foot on the off side
floats it fuller this time close to off, he is late in coming forward and squeezes it out to third man
a shuffle and a work wide of midwicket, and a single is comfortably taken
Kallis digs in the bouncer, it takes him by surprise, and he drops wrists in the end, bounced way above him in the end
Kallis gets one now, Niall went charging down the track, got beside the line of one going across him, looking to go over extra cover, but got a faint tickle on its way through to the keeper
141.3 kph lifter outside off stump, the old shoulders are putting in a lot of effort, he fends it away down to third man
way down the pads from Morne, he just picks it off his legs down to the fine leg boundary
beats him now with one that lurks outside off stump, and he goes stabbing at it
this time he manages to stab at one outside off stump, and it rolls away past second slip to third man
Joyce gets some rare width this time outside off stump, it is there for the drive, and he does so with good timing past extra cover
shuffles across outside off stump to defend a length ball
leaves alone a straight ball outside off stump
goes poking with an angled bat at one that bounces outside off stump, and it bounces perilously close to off stump
gets behind the line of one around off stump, and defends solidly
playing from the crease, lets a length ball come on and pushes it away on the leg side
off the inside half of the blade back to the bowler as he gets too far across outside off stump to a length ball
languidly cut away off the back foot to extra cover, poetic non-violence as it were
whoops, now he jumps in the air to try and upper cut a lifting delivery outside off stump, but even his airborne efforts don't connect with the ball
tosses it up from round the wicket, and he slams the drive down the ground
and he takes those boundary riders on, lifts this flighted delivery in the air, and in the gap between long on and deep midwicket, none of whom had a chance
turned to deep midwicket off the legs
smashed off the front foot to extra cover on the edge of the circle

Joyce goes for the sweep to a delivery that angles in, misses and is hit on the pads, umpire Dharmasena sends him back, but Ireland go for the review, and that would have hit middle and leg, Ireland are reeling here

shoulders arms to one that turns back in a long way, Botha is sure he has got him, but the umpire does not agree, it struck him some way outside off stump, would it have gone on to hit the stumps, we'll wait for the replay, missing off by a long way
left alone from a length outside the off stump
driven wide of mid off for a single off the front foot
bounces from short of a good length outside off, good rhythm from Kallis, left alone again
cracked away off the back foot, it is JP at point who races to his right and dives to field the ball, superb effort

Kevin goes down, ducks right into a bouncer that did not bounce, takes it on the back, that must have hurt considering the manner in which he sank to the ground, and van Wyk rubs it in by throwing down the stumps, but he is in by a long way
gives him the short one again, this time Kevin is ready and pulls it backward of square leg with a flourish
pushed through flat, and turns from around middle, defended off the back foot
what a shot, Peterson drops it short, he does not go for the pull, he just stays in the crease and scyth-jab-lifts it high in the air over deep midwicket, one leg in the air as he does that
left alone outside off stump
loud appeal for lbw, but there seemed to be an inside edge on that one as he pushed forward in defence
squirted away on the leg side
goes back and eases in to the cut shot, but cannot beat the infield
jams his bat at this one that is angled in and gets it in the air on the leg side
pushed away to point off the back foot
turned with the angle wide of Morne at fine leg who makes good ground to his right, puts in the dive and stops the boundary
goes for the pull and sends it in to the clouds, but it falls in the vacant expanses wide of deep midwicket
fuller this time, he remains in the crease and jabs it away in front of midwicket
comes in from a length outside off stump, defended calmly down the track
KOB puts a heavy foot forward and bunts back down the wicket
tapped just behind point for a quick single
flight, drift and a hint of turn for Robbie! That gripped and spun away to beat the edge of the bat
driven to extra cover
Wilson stretches well forward and defends to the off side
nudged to square leg, good tight over
tossed up high on off stump, nudged back to the bowler
turned round to square leg, but straight to the fielder there
flatter through the air, but speared down the leg side, and they run one as van Wyk can't hold it cleanly. He's of the impression that touched the batsman, but the umpire doesn't think so
down to third man! This one rushed straight on, genuine but there's no slip. Was that the doosra? "Jerky action" says Bumble, with foreboding...
this one does turn back in, defended
solid stuff from Botha, giving nothing away, turned to leg
tapped gently to mid-on
flicked across the front pad, and just behind square on the leg side for one
Peterson stays round the wicket, Wilson stretches forward and defends to gully
he's forward again, defending slightly awkwardly to cover
slightly too short, Wilson stays back and slaps down to long-off
paddle-sweep from O'Brien, he gets some glove/bat on it to get the ball down to fine leg
lobbed up really high, Wilson steps onto the front foot and drives to extra cover on the bounce
full on middle, pushed powerfully down the ground
this time he's just a touch too short, Wilson stands up and forces to long on too
two lengths from Botha, now O'Brien is forward again and picks up one with a flick of the wrists
Botha holds this one back a touch, Wilson is a bit early and a leading edge pops up off the bat ... no danger though
quicker one this time, very full. Wilson glances off the toes down to fine leg
regulation offspinner on off stump, O'Brien offers sturdy defence
slightly too short and he's cut, but straight to the point fielder
there's the placement! Again a little short, Wilson steps back and this time makes sure to slice it much finer, down to wide third man
Wilson slightly unsure whether to go forward or back, and eventually chops down on the ball to send it bouncing to point
this one goes straight on, but starts on a leg stump line so even though he's struck on the pad there's no appeal - going down leg
flighted up on leg stump, clipped hard back to the bowler
again he tosses it up nice and full, driven back
O'Brien steps to leg before the ball is bowled, but Botha follows him. Clipped to midwicket
fuller and quicker, again he picks out that midwicket fielder
swept hard, but along the ground, down to long leg
tossed up and slightly short, cracked to cover without much timing

that should've been a run-out! Wilson dabbed it straight to short third man and they set off, the throw went to the right end - the non-striker - but it wasn't on target as Wilson dived into the crease
chipped off the back foot and in the air out to deep midwicket. Deliberately lifted
over extra cover! O'Brien shimmies down to meet the ball on the full and slaps it hard to the off side, in the air
tapped to cover, O'Brien wanders out of his crease but there was never, ever a single there
gone this time! O'Brien was aiming for long-on but sliced across the ball, skying it up for Hashim Amla to take an easy catch at long-off. No O'Brien show tonight ...
nudged to point

arm ball from Peterson, Wilson is wrapped on the pads to spark a huge appeal ... and he's given! After a quick chat, they review it, but to no avail. Ireland lose both of their set batsmen in the space of three balls, and they're sliding now
dropped by Kallis at slip! Peterson pitched one up quite wide of off, Mooney lunged at it and the edge flew at very catchable height to Kallis' right ... but hit the fingers and just bounced out
solidly defended to cover
Mooney leans across into a paddle-sweep, but doesn't connect
full on off stump, punched down to long-off
lobbed down wide of off, Cusack has nothing to do with it, left alone
driven to mid-off, who is a little deep so they take the single
full on middle, but Mooney steps forward to defend
tapped down to gully, no run there
quicker arm ball from Peterson, rushing on and there's a speculative appeal ... but that was bat and pad together

and again, half an appeal ... but hang on, they've asked for a review. It's definitely pad first ... for some reason there's an interminable delay here. He's more than 2.5 metres down, the ball was clipping the top of the middle and off stumps, and Umpire Dharmasena says "not out"
big heave from Cusack, the ball flies off the edge and down to third man for four
tapped to extra cover off the back foot
a touch too short, slapped out to deep cover
slogged in the air with minimal timing, out to deep midwicket ... dropping well short
angled down to gully
there's timing! Mooney slaps a sweep out to the midwicket boundary on bended now, all along the ground and right out the middle
much slower through the air from Botha, the ball grips and spins but Mooney is well forward to cover it
pushed gently into the gap at cover
flicked to midwicket off the back foot
solidly defended to extra cover
punched off the back foot this time, but he picks out midwicket
yes, no, yes, no from the batsmen, but fortunately Cusack is sent back in time
slog-swept out to deep midwicket, the ball is fielded on the bounce

Peterson's got another one! Well with the required rate rising they had to try and target the boundary, no point just knocking it around. Cusack took a couple of steps down and tried to mow it down the ground, but the ball spun away from him, taking a thick edge and swirling up for a catch in the covers
driven into the off side, extra cover runs across and dives to stop the run
slashed square drive from Mooney, the ball beats point but the cover sweeper runs round to cut it off
flicked through square leg
defended gently back to the bowler
looped to leg slip! Was there an inside edge on that? Botha isn't the least bit interested and yes, that's come off only the pad
drilled to mid-off, he's off the mark
defended to cover, Mooney wants a single but there's none on offer
Johnston drops the ball towards cover and lumbers out of the crease ... only to be sent back
flicked to leg, no run
big hit! Johnston steps down to a floater on middle and slams it straight down the ground. He's going down in a blaze of glory
tucked off the pad to midwicket
Trent looks for another big shot, skipping out of the crease but slamming it straight down to long-on, a couple of bounces to the fielder
defended into the leg side
defended quietly into the leg side
slapped with rather more intent, but straight to the midwicket fielder
chopped down through point, they ease through for one
a mighty swing from Mooney, not sure where he was aiming to hit that but he didn't get anywhere near it. Spin and bounce take the ball away from the swinging blade
fuller, driven to extra cover
Mooney steps forward in defence, the ball strikes him on the pad to draw "oohs" and "aahs" from the close fielders
pushed through quickly, Johnston plays for non-existent turn and is beaten on the outside edge
drop-and-run to cover, quick single taken
pushed down the ground
speared in flat again, Johnston chops the ball down through gully for a couple as Kallis creaks after it
caught behind! Johnston presses forward and again the ball doesn't spin an inch, taking a clear outside edge and nestling in van Wyk's right glove
glanced down to fine leg ... the fielder is after it but it slips past him
loosener, landing on a length outside off. Mooney swishes, and is beaten
a rasping cut goes straight out to the man at deep cover
dug in quite short, Dockrell stands tall and angles it down to third man
Kallis comes round the wicket, full on off stump and driven to cover
airy drive outside off, the ball scoots past the inside edge
and now he's beaten on the outside edge, minimal reaction from the South Africans though, they're just sort of going through the motions at the moment
Duminy comes round the wicket to Dockrell, who taps back to the bowler
arm ball, rushes straight on to beat the outside edge
and again! Fuller this time, but same result
skewed off the outside half of the bat, into the covers
Mooney flicks across his front pad to send the ball out to deep midwicket
stylish drive from Dockrell, it beats a diving cover
this one hits the seam and comes in, but Dockrell is right behind the line to defend
wide of off, Dockrell throws the bat at it and the ball flies wide of the lone slip and down to the third man boundary!
a thick inside edge rolls into the leg side, and they steal a quick single

just one more to go now, Kallis comes round the wicket, Mooney drives and the edge goes straight through to van Wyk. He beat him a couple of times in the last over, now he gets one to touch the bat as Mooney drives rooted to the crease
Kallis stays round the wicket to the left-handed Rankin, who pops the ball up towards midwicket ... but it drops safe
no danger of Rankin getting in line with the ball ... he stands on leg stump and pushes the hands out, the ball zips past the outside edge
cracked over cover! Is there anything George Dockrell can't do?

superb catch from van Wyk! Morkel slammed one down much shorter, it leapt up at young Dockrell and took the edge of the shoulder of the bat, the keeper tumbled to his right to complete the dismissal and that's the end of Ireland
